alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 10:21PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Washington and east central Hancock Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1019 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Deblois, or 11 miles west of Cherryfield, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cherryfield, Steuben, Harrington, Columbia Falls, Columbia, Deblois, Franklin, Addison, Sullivan, Eastbrook and Beddington. This includes US Highway 1 between Cherryfield and Columbia Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Washington; Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock
